intro: Cheiranthus axillaris, commonly known as the rock wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in early spring. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environments, making it a resilient and hardy species.
